message: Participants receive lifetime access to 18 hours of live, interactive sessions, 10 hours of step-by-step coding instructions, a final project with direct feedback, 100 coding assignments and practice questions, the entire source code of a working production system, access to a private community, direct access to the instructor, lifetime access to past and future cohorts, and a program certificate upon completion.
Yes, live sessions of the program are recorded.

The cost to join the program is $500, and it includes lifetime access to every past, present, and future cohort, 18 hours of live interactive sessions, 10 hours of step-by-step coding instructions, a final project with direct feedback, 100 coding assignments and practice questions, the entire source code of a working production system, access to a private community, direct access to the instructor, a program certificate upon completion, and the ability to participate in as many iterations as desired.
The cost associated with joining the program is $500, which is a one-time payment for lifetime access with no monthly fees, annual fees, or hidden costs.
The next cohort for the 'Building Machine Learning Systems That Don't Suck' program is scheduled for February 3 - 20, 2025.
Some strategies mentioned for active learning in the course are uncertainty and diversity sampling strategies.

You'll design and write the code to build an end-to-end machine learning system starting from scratch. You'll learn best practices to tackle the most significant challenges machine learning engineers face to build, evaluate, run, monitor, and maintain machine learning systems in real-world scenarios.
Juan Olano
You only pay once to join the program and get immediate access to every past, present, and future cohort.

The program's live sessions for building machine learning systems include 18 hours of live, interactive sessions, 10 hours of step-by-step coding instructions, and the opportunity to receive feedback and support from the instructor and community.

To enroll in the program, one must pay a one-time fee of $500. This fee provides lifetime access to every past, present, and future cohort of the program, with no additional monthly fees, annual fees, or hidden costs.

Upon enrollment in the machine learning program, the resources and benefits provided include:

- 18 hours of live, interactive sessions discussing first principles behind building machine learning systems
- 10 hours of step-by-step coding instructions on building an end-to-end system from scratch
- A final project with direct feedback on your work
- 100 coding assignments and practice questions
- Access to the entire source code of a working production system
- A private community for collaboration with thousands of people from different backgrounds
- Direct access to the instructor
- Lifetime access to every past and future cohort
- Program certificate upon completion

Unique or exclusive materials provided include:
- Lifetime access to all past, present, and future cohorts
- The entire source code of a working production system for personal use
- Direct feedback from the instructor
- Access to a private community for collaboration and support

Overall, the program emphasizes practical, hands-on learning with a focus on building real-world machine learning systems.

You will acquire practical skills in designing and writing code to build an end-to-end machine learning system from scratch, tackling significant challenges in building, evaluating, running, monitoring, and maintaining machine learning systems in real-world scenarios.

The upcoming Cohort 17 of the program will start on February 3, 2025, and end on February 20, 2025. The weekly schedule for Cohort 17 is as follows:

- Monday: Live session at 10:00 AM EST for 2 hours.
- Tuesday: Individual work.
- Wednesday: Optional office hours.
- Thursday: Live session at 10:00 AM EST for 2 hours.
- Friday: Individual work.
The copyright is registered under Tideily LLC. All rights are reserved. Contact details provided are svpino@gmail.com.

In Session 1 of the program, the main subjects discussed include:
- The differences between production machine learning and traditional machine learning approaches.
- Strategies to solve the right problem using the right solution.
- Critical questions to ask before starting any project.
- Techniques for problem framing, inversion, and the haystack principle for building successful applications.
- The first rule of machine learning engineering and how to start building.
- Data collection strategies and determining the amount of data needed.
- Dealing with selection bias and labeling data.
- Using active learning strategies for data sampling.
Overall, Session 1 focuses on providing insights and practical skills for initiating and executing machine learning projects in a production environment.
You can access recordings of the live sessions from the Machine Learning School program if you decide to attend classes live or catch up asynchronously later using the recording.
Some of the strategies for active learning highlighted in the course are uncertainty sampling and diversity sampling.

The upcoming cohort of the 'Building Machine Learning Systems That Don't Suck' program starts on February 3, 2025. Live sessions for this cohort will take place every Monday and Thursday at 10:00 AM EST, with additional sessions on Wednesdays. This cohort runs from February 3 to February 20, 2025, and each iteration of the program provides 18 hours of hands-on, live training spread over 3 weeks.
You only pay once to join the program and get immediate access to every past, present, and future cohort.
Those interested in implementing the concepts discussed in class should set aside 2 to 4 hours weekly to complete the code walkthroughs and work on the assignments.

Participants in the program will gain practical skills in building machine learning systems, problem framing, data collection strategies, coding instructions, and building end-to-end solutions. Additionally, they will have access to coding assignments, feedback from the community and instructor, and the opportunity to collaborate with others in a private community. This emphasis on practical skills and interactive learning can benefit participants with disabilities by providing them with the tools and support needed to succeed in the program.
The course covers uncertainty and diversity sampling strategies for active learning.

Yes, in the context of the program, 'lifetime access' means that participants will have ongoing access to all course materials and updates, even if they are unable to complete the program due to unforeseen circumstances.

In the first session of the machine learning program, participants will learn about what makes production machine learning different from what they may have learned previously. They will also be introduced to the strategy for solving the right problem using the right solution, critical questions to ask before starting any project, problem framing, inversion, and the haystack principle for building successful applications. Additionally, they will learn about the first rule of machine learning engineering, data collection strategies, and techniques to determine how to start building. Participants who prefer to watch recorded sessions at their own pace can benefit from the flexibility of accessing the session recordings and going through the content at a speed that suits their learning style.
The one-time payment to join the program is $500, and there are no additional costs associated with accessing advanced modules or resources.

In this context, "lifetime access" means that once you pay to join the program, you will have access to every past, present, and future cohort of the program. This means you can participate in as many iterations of the program as you'd like without any additional fees.
You only pay once to join the program and there are no monthly fees, annual fees, or hidden costs. Once you join, you have lifetime access to every past, present, and future cohort.

Upon joining the machine learning program, you would receive 18 hours of live, interactive sessions, 10 hours of step-by-step coding instructions, a final project with direct feedback, 100 coding assignments and practice questions, the entire source code of a working production system, access to a private community for collaboration, direct access to the instructor, lifetime access to every past and future cohort, a program certificate upon completion, and the ability to benefit from updates and improvements made to the program in the future.
Cohort 17 starts on February 3 and ends on February 20, 2025. Live sessions will take place every Monday and Thursday at 10:00 AM EST, with additional sessions on Wednesdays.

You would learn techniques like active learning, distributed training, adversarial validation, human-in-the-loop deployments, model compression, test-time augmentation, and testing in the machine learning program that offer practical, real-world skills.
The next cohort for the 'Building Machine Learning Systems That Don't Suck' program is scheduled for February 3 - 20, 2025.

The topics covered in Session 2 of the course on the Machine Learning School Website include data cleaning, feature engineering, turning data into numbers using vectorization techniques, producing homogeneous features using normalization and standardization, handling and interpreting missing values using imputation techniques, choosing the best model, overfitting, hyperparameter tuning, experiment tracking, and measuring the quality of the holdout set.
The cost structure for joining the Machine Learning School program with lifetime access to all past and future cohorts is a one-time payment of $500.

The program offers a practical, hands-on learning approach for machine learning. Participants will have access to 18 hours of live, interactive sessions, 10 hours of step-by-step coding instructions, a final project with direct feedback, 100 coding assignments and practice questions, the entire source code of a production system, a private community for collaboration, direct access to the instructor, lifetime access to past and future cohorts, and a program certificate upon completion.

Some key benefits offered by the program include lifetime access, 18 hours of live interactive sessions, 10 hours of coding instructions, 100 coding assignments, access to the complete source code of a production system, feedback and support from the community, and direct feedback from the instructor.

The topics covered in the first session include:
- What makes production machine learning different from what you've learned
- Strategies to solve the right problem using the right solution
- Critical questions to ask before starting any project
- Problem framing, inversion, and the haystack principle for building successful applications
- The first rule of machine learning engineering and how to start building
- Data collection strategies

The focus of the 'Building Machine Learning Systems That Don't Suck' course is to help participants build production-ready machine learning systems from the ground up. The next cohort is scheduled to start on February 3 - 20, 2025.
The contact person is Santiago and the name of the company mentioned in the context is Tideily LLC.

You will gain practical skills in designing and writing code to build end-to-end machine learning systems from scratch. The unique aspects of the Machine Learning School program include lifetime access to live sessions, step-by-step coding instructions, access to the complete source code of a production system, feedback and support from a community, direct feedback from the instructor, and the opportunity to start freelancing on Upwork.
The course discusses active learning using uncertainty and diversity sampling strategies. The techniques covered for handling missing values include imputation techniques.

The cost structure for joining the machine learning program is that you only pay once to join and there are no monthly fees, annual fees, or hidden costs. The program is designed for technical professionals such as software engineers, data scientists, data analysts, machine learning engineers, technical managers, and anyone who wants to use machine learning to solve real-world problems.

The cost to join the program is a one-time payment of $500, with lifetime access provided. There are no monthly fees, annual fees, or hidden costs. Participants can join as many iterations of the program as they'd like and have access to every past, present, and future cohort.

"Lifetime access" in the context of the machine learning program means that once you join the program by paying a one-time fee, you will have immediate access to every past, present, and future cohort of the program. This means you can benefit from updates and improvements in the program indefinitely. The instructor of the program is Santiago, a machine learning engineer with over two decades of experience building and scaling enterprise software and machine learning systems.

If you are attending the live sessions, you should set aside a minimum of 4 hours every week during the three weeks of the program.
